actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide tax relief for middle-income taxpayers by increasing the personal exemption amount and to provide additional revenues by increasing the taxes paid by high-income individuals and corporations.
short_title: Middle Class Tax Relief Act of 1991

summary.text: Middle Class Tax Relief Act of 1991 - Title I: Tax Relief for Middle-Income Taxpayers - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to provide an additional exemption amount ($1,000) to the regular personal exemption ($2,000) for middle-income taxpayers. Specifies the maximum gross income amounts for such taxpayers. Provides a formula for reducing the additional exemption amount for middle-income taxpayers whose incomes exceed certain transitional dollar amounts. Provides for inflation adjustments of amounts under this title. Title II: Revenue Provisions - Increases the individual income tax rates for certain higher-income taxpayers. Imposes a surtax on the individual tax rate or the alternative minimum tax rate for individuals whose incomes exceed $225,000. Increases the rate of corporate income tax and the alternative minimum tax.

titles.title: Middle Class Tax Relief Act of 1991

To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide tax relief for middle-income taxpayers by increasing the personal exemption amount and to provide additional revenues by increasing the taxes paid by high-income individuals and corporations.
